caption: This is our personal fav!! We absolutely love the food, ambiance and the people here.
Amazing service and people..   Mario himself came by for a nice conversation.   Please support this great spot!
Mario's food was excellent ! 30 years of Italian cuisine still tastes like moms in the kitchen!
Very good service!

We sat outside at Mario's Table and it was fabulous!  Mario is such a wonderful owner/host!  The grilled and fried calamari is amazing!  My hubby loves their eggplant parmigiana and I had the Rocco steak medallions. Our favorite wine came from Mario's. Plungerhead Petit Syrah is the best. Thanks for a wonderful evening Mario and staff!👍🍷👏
Was there for the 1st time celebrating a friends birthday...was NOT DISAPPOINTED😊😊I can see why my friends encouraged me to go..this will not be the last
Authentic Italian food! The gnocchi was so delicious! Followed by the Tiramisu and a Espresso Martini. Portions are huge. The outdoor patio was so quaint and quiet. Service was friendly and prompt.

It was far more than that. My friend first comment was “I love this place”! And, that was due to the excellent, very friendly staff who treated you like you were a regular — which most everyone else in the place was. We both wished that this was our neighborhood Italian restaurant. The food was perfect for both of us and everything that others had looked just as good. Try anything! I think you will enjoy whatever you choose.
Love this place. Authentic food. Great servers. Small town feel. Best gluten free pizza I've ever had.

Whatever you order, do not get the pasta with clams. They are canned and looked like ground up tuna. The fishy smell emanating from the noodles was so bad that I could not take more than two bites. I spent the entire night just eating bread and olive oil. Needless to say I did not get a box to take it home.
I will definitely recommend l!
Food, service, ambiance excellent
Great service
SO GROSS  - visited in November last year.  Cockroach was crawling on the wall at the end of our meal....they should have closed the restaurant as soon as that happened - unfortunately they did not!
Everything we ate was terrific!
Had a great dinner and a really good time enjoying it!! Great service and very warm atmosphere. Mario is a great host!

Great local family Italian restaurant in the Gold Coast. Went in with my mom, sister and nephew and we really enjoyed it! Had the vodka sauce ravioli as well as  minestrone soup and a couple pizzas. The service was great, everyone is very friendly and they offer gluten free options as well which is nice. Definitely going back, I heard the sausage and peppers is great.
Extensive menu. Good prices.  Good food. Comfortable atmosphere. Family friendly.
This is my favourite neighborhood restaurant. Food consistently good, service always friendly.
Solid Italian food
Not real good Italian I've had much better.
It's as good as the reviews say! Molto Bene!! Service and food were excellent!
Wonderful experience! The veal piccata was delicious! Service was some of the best I’ve ever had.
Great eggplant Parmesan.

This place was a find for two West Coast tourists. Our hotel was nearby so we tried it as it looked appealing. It was far more than that. My friend first comment was “I love this place”! And, that was due to the excellent, very friendly staff who treated you like you were a regular — which most everyone else in the place was. We both wished that this was our neighborhood Italian restaurant. The food was perfect for both of us and everything that others had looked just as good. Try anything! I think you will enjoy whatever you choose.

Ate here two nights in a row. Veal piccata then veal saltimbucca. Both delicious, but what really made them special was served on a bed of angel hair pasta, which allowed you to sop up the scrumptious sauces. Neither was heavy. Just light and flavorful. Fresh bread with olive oil. Good wine list, great neighborhood atmosphere, and attentive service. Good prices too. Hidden gem. Don’t be put off by the hotel entrance.

The food was decent but expensive. My mom and I went, had paid our bill and just finished our drinks. We were pleasantly talking to the table next to us. The manager (I'm guessing it was the manger) asked us to leave because they wanted the table. We were even thinking about getting another drink there. It was very rude to be asked to leave. We won't be back.
A bit of a hidden gem with a great neighborhood feel. Great menu with different seasonal and fresh specials.

Fantastic food in a hidden gem of a restaurant inside an apartment high rise. Loved everything I ate. The ravioli bites as an appetizer were especially delicious, and they make one of the better manhattans that I’ve ever had. That said, I thought the service overall was lacking and felt rushed - even for eating alone on a mostly empty night.
Great atmosphere, greater service, and excellent food and choices.!
Wonderful place great staff So good. Thank you
Great Italian food with familiar atmosphere. Mario is the NICEST and his staff is extremely accommodating to our quick in and out requests on nights we have a meeting in the area.

Mario's Table is a great neighborhood Italian Italian restaurant. The salad was fresh and I enjoyed the shrimp scampi. My parents enjoyed the eggplant parmesan and vodka sauce pasta. The service was prompt and friendly. Mario himself walked around and said hello. Despite a number of fruit flies and bugs near our table, was a positive dining experience.
Fabulous food anf fantastic service.!
Wonderful, family owned restaurant. The salmon was absolutely delicious!
The best Italian ever! I wanted something not on the menu and they made it special for me!!!
Love Marios when I’m in the neighborhood. Can never go wrong with two for Tuesday’s (2 for 1 wine)!
Super friendly and never fails to impress.
Best place to eat Italian in Chicago
Really Great Food

This is a neighbourhood gem.  Hidden in an appartement building, Mario’s Table will offer you Italian comfort food.  The staff is friendly and welcoming. The atmosphere is calm and you don’t feel like you have to shout to hold a conversation.  You will not be disappointed with anything on their menu and that’s a promise.  Great value for your money.  Enjoy!

Cant say enough amazing things about this place. Service is always amazing, food is always great.  I live in the building so I come to this place two to three times a week.  Drew and Anthony behind the bar always great me with my drink and the staff is always nice.  Everything on the menu is great!
Excellent italian dining...a cheers atmosphere must go
Great local Italian restaurant. Fast service, good food... Good place for locals...
Delicious food!
Outstanding! Delicious mix of grilled and fried calamari.  I hearted the zesty seafood diavolo.  Tiramisu is great!   Excellent drink menu.

Needed a place for dinner after driving into Chicago for a short weekend getaway. Mario's  Table was across from our hotel. The food was amazing! Perfection! I'd take the train to Chicago just for dinner at Mario's .
Fast friendly service Great food Mario s a great host
Great food and service...Owner even stops by a few times to make sure everything is great!!!
Wonderful neighborhood Italian restaurant with good food and very friendly and helpful staff.  Two for Tuesdays are a great value for wine drinkers!

Love this place. It is always quiet when I go in which is before six. Good Italian food in the classic way, plate of olive oil with parmesan and fresh bread brought to your table before anything. You'll like it. Pasta and pizza above par.
Always a great experience
Overpriced. I almost suspect that the pizza was frozen, the crust was impossibly thin and cracker like. Additionally it was perfectly round. Taste was unremarkable as well.

Our party of nine, including our two small grandsons,  ate at Mario’s Table last evening for my husband’s birthday. We couldn’t have had a better experience!  The food is outstanding and the service amazing! The owner, Mario, frequently stopped by our table to make sure everything was fine. We will definitely be back!

It was close to the kitchen closing time on Saturday night yet Mario and staff still welcomed the 6 of us in for drinks and food as if it was a regular dinner hour. The food was great and we also took a to go order of salad and pizza. They were very attentive! Thanks so much for the great experience. We will be back and tell others about how awesome you were.
Nice , cool, looking place.  Great people. The food is alright. Like the atmosphere and the people.

Mario's Table is the Gold Coast's favorite restaurant. It is a cozy neighborhood restaurant with great Italian food and where everyone meet to eat! You can celebrate any occasion at this cozy Italian restaurant. Great food and customer service. The low lighting is perfect for a romantic evening. The Eggplant parmesan is fabulous as like the pasta, Salads, Seafood, Chicken, Desserts, Vegetarian and the rest of the meal. The ambience is wonderful. The staff is very pleasant and the service exactly attentive and very fast. From GKN SECRET SHOPPER.
Can't beat two-fer Tuesdays.
Food was great. Atmosphere was great. Great family run joint. Highly recommend!
Great food and service
Great food. Mario is the best.
Great food great experience!! Do yourself a favor and go!

This restaurant was a found GEM. Warm and inviting.  Mario himself was actually greeting each table with great interest. I could not say enough about how incredible this lasagna was. Even better than my own. Many thanks to this wonderful family who really made our 10 year anniversary so special!
Great food and service. The Tilapia with angel hair was delicious. Highly recommend.
Warm and quiet place, good food and cocktails!
Great food and customer service. The low lighting is perfect for a romantic evening. It is a little pricey.
Great food, atmosphere.
Great neighborhood place. Good traditional Italian food
Great food, Great service , great price
I thought that there is no way for those ~$30 dishes written on an undecorated piece of paper not being overprised, and I was wrong.
Eggplant parmesan was scrumptious.
Excellent service, excellent food, casual, comfortable and fast. Everything I would want in a restaurant.
Great service and food!
Good local for pizza, great staff.
Great food and service even though super busy. John behind the bar is awesome!
What a wonderful local spot! Food was FRESH- potions were ample- service was great ! Great spot before Second City Comedy Show. Hidden neighborhood GEM!
Mario is the nicest guy. Fun vibe in this place. Food is spectacular. Stumbled upon this gem by accident the first time. Have been back three times. Will go again.

Food was good, service was appalling. They tried to bring out the main course twice whilst still eating our starters & were shocked when we said we weren’t ready for our main course, obviously had been reheated once they did bring out the main.
Mario and his staff always provide a great experience!
Best Chicken Parm!
Great italian food.
Great neighbourhood spot!

This restaurant is NOT KIDS FRIENDLY at all. Don’t be fooled by the crayons, kids menu and a plastic cup with a lid. We arrived for dinner at 6:10 pm, quickly ordered our main entree and after finishing our dinner (right after receiving our bill) the owner came up to our table and hushed our 2 1/2 year old and said he had to keep it down because there were 2 guests sitting by our table (a father with his late teen or college age daughter). First of all, our son stayed seated in his high chair at all times, he was playing with his own toys and never made any sounds with his toys, the plates nor the utensils. He wasn’t squirmy. He wasn’t even watching videos on a phone nor iPad, which I think the background noise in those gadgets tend to be annoying to other people sometimes. The whole time we were there, he never made a mess with the food, never fussed and didn’t even cry. He was in a good mood and we were so proud of him for behaving so well and for eating his meal. After finishing his meal, he got excited and asked for candy (referring to the mints he saw by the entrance). He never screamed he just asked by raising his voice, but nothing louder compared to the chatter and music going on in the background. Do you think a 2 year old has a powerful voice? He wasn’t even having a tantrum... he was simply excited because we had promise him that if he ate he would get mints and he just asked for “candy” 2-3 times after finishing his plate. The people by our table never seemed to mind, they kept talking between themselves throughout the night without staring at us. But somehow, Mario the owner decided to leave a sour taste to our night by hushing our son and the telling us he had to keep it down. Mario, the bill was standing right in front of your face, we were about to leave anyways... do you really have to treat clients like that? That is rude and disrespectful. We were about to leave and you decide to make a scene over a little innocent and powerless voice that was just asking for candy? Ridiculous owner. He probably never had kids and if he did they probably didn’t even like him. If you do not believe me, please go ahead and read the other negative reviews written by families with kids and you will get a sense of what type of person Mario is. Bottom line: I DO NOT RECOMMEND this place to anyone that has CHILDREN. MARIO, if you don’t like kids, then do not offer kid’s menus nor crayons you STUCK UP. And please, don’t be a hypocrite and start greeting families when they come in, specially if they are accompanied by their children. We don’t need you to FAKE your intentions.  All you want is the $ and when you are about to cash in the receipt, that is when your true colors come out. KID’S HATER.

TERRIBLE experience with Mario who yelled at our 2 year old toddler for being too loud. My son is a saint and I’m not just saying that because I’m his dad. Mario came to our table and told us that “he had to quiet down because he was bothering the people next to us”. He had the balls to say this as we were leaving and paying our check! We were in complete and utter SHOCK by how uncomfortable and regretful he made us feel. If you have children take my advice and go to other GREAT Italian restaurants in the city of Chicago such as Carmine’s or Lou Malnati’s. Don’t waste your time here if you’re bringing your precious children, you don’t want to hear what we heard from Mario should your toddler act like a toddler. Mario stop harassing your customers with kids and learn how to be a human. Because of your comment I’m NEVER coming here again and NOT RECOMMENDING to anyone.
This neighborhood place has staff that rocks!

One of the worst Italian restaurant, actually an Italian/American, in Chicago. There are so many good ones. Pasta is extremely overcooked, sauce has no flavor. Please go to Carmine's, Bar Lupo or other for better Italian/American food.
Cozy place to have a nice meal. Good food and reasonable prices. Very friendly wait staff.
Good simple Italian.  Nice service and easy going.
Deliscious
Good food in a classic, informal setting
Great little local eatery - good food reasonably priced.
Nice, small place. Great food. A little dark though...

Our first Italian restaurant visit since moving to Chicago and it was wonderful.  The Eggplant parmesan was fabulous as was the pasta and the rest of the meal. The staff were very pleasant and the service exactly how it should be....attentive but not hovering.  The ambience was wonderful.  We will definitely recommend this hidden jewel to all. Definitely earned a 5 star rating!

TERRIBLE experience at this restaurant. For much better Italian and a much better experience try Topo Gigio or Orso's on Wells in Old Town.  We took our daughter here for her first birthday and we were yelled at by the owner because she dropped spaghetti on the floor (which we fully intended to clean up). The owner told us that one year-olds keep their food on the table at his restaurant and then called the busboy over to pack up our remaining food to go. Thank you to the couple next to us who were so shocked and angered that they insisted on picking up our check (totally sweet and unnecessary).
Great place will be back
It is a wonderful little Italian restaurant.
BEST Chicken Marsala I've ever had. Amazing!!
Cozy, old school Chitown Italian. Inviting bar, quiet tables. Nice neighborhood.

Fantastic Italian food! Our party of 8 stayed for 3 hours (by choice) and our waiter was great. Had the 4 cheese lasagna and I highly recommend it! Chocolate Thunder is a great dessert option as well.
Food, service and atmosphere are all amazing. John the bartender made our experience flawless. Beautiful gem in the city!
Best pizza I've had in the States so far. Simplicity has more. And for a fair price too. Lovely owner who likes to meet his guests personally. Nice, cozy and hassle free.

We spent the night in the city for Valentines Day and found Marios Table across the street from our hotel. It was warm and inviting. From the moment we sat down, the service was outstanding. From the delicious warm bread to the fresh bruschetta appetizer, amazingly flavorful shrimp scampi and veal marsala to the very last bite of the best tirimisu ever...we loved every bite and hated to see our dinner end!  The meal was one of our all-time favorites and we can't wait to return!  Definitely a little Gold Coast hidden gem!!
Loved the service, food, and drinks!
Great lamb chopso! Love me some Mario's!!!
I feel like grandma is cooking in the kitchen for me.  It's a real homey feel.  People who work there are amazing.
Good food, friendly owner - walked by and said hello
Great neighborhood place. Good for families or a date. Best calamari in Chicago and Tues is by 1 get one glasses of wine.
Best place in Chicago. Mario is a rock star. Highly recommend. Food is fantastic. Location a 10.
Great local fresh pasta!
Service, food, drinks, fabulous.
Best food and wine ever!

Just love this place.  Off the beaten path in the Gold Coast neighborhood and not on a big street. Definitely a great spot to go to for a low key, phenomenally prepared Italian meal.  Always will go here when I have a chance!

(Translated by Google) We loved the food, prepared at home. The owner himself goes through the tables to see how your dinner is and if you like it. The staff, despite having the place full, was always attentive to our needs.  (Original) Nos encantó la comida, preparada como en casa. El propio dueño pasa por las mesas para ver como esta tu cena y si te gusta. El personal, a pesar de tener el lugar lleno, estuvo siempre atento a nuestras necesidades.
Loved it.  Everyone in our party enjoyed their food.  I had veal saltimbocca, it was fantastic!  Wonderful servers, prompt and attentive.

After recently moving into the neighborhood, I was personally greeted by Mario himself. His warm, friendly invite is an exact personification of the welcoming environment you can find within the restaurant. The food was authentic. My favorite dish thus far is the Calamari two ways. Definitely a great way to spend an evening.
The cherry one is really good
Very good local restaurant. Try the jumbolaya pasta.

Having been a wine consultant for over 20 years, one also becomes familiar with fine dining. In a period of 10 days I dined here 4 times! Not once did I find a single thing that was not done to the highest standard, from being greeted at the door to service and food, oh the food!! If you are looking for fine Italian food just a block north of Division and Dearborn Parkway Mario's is the best bet on the gold coast.
This is a great neighborhood place! Great food and great service and always realiable.
We live in the same condo and therefore frequent the Ristorante and love the food and ambience.
